icontrol.drivers.instruments.yokogawa

Class YokogawaDL9000

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.yokogawa.YokogawaDL9000

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=TMCTL,
               InstrumentClassName="Yokogawa DL9000")
public class YokogawaDL9000
extends Device
    This class implements functionality to communicate with a Yokogawa DL9000 series digital sampling oscilloscope. It was developed and tested on a DL9240L oscilloscope.

    This class uses Yokogawa's TMCTL library, which is encapsulated in TMCTL_Driver. This driver supports Ethernet, USB, GPIB, and RS232 communication. USB is fastest (1.6 sec for 1 MB) followed by Ethernet (2.3 sec) and GPIB (3.2 sec). The TMCTL driver allows to select either protocol, and at the time of writing, only the USBTMC(DL9000) protocol is supported. Please contact the developer if you like to use other protocols.

    The TMCTL library requires a special USB Driver to be installed to be able to communicate with the DL9000 Series oscilloscope. This driver can be downloaded from and it is also copied into the _misc folder of the developers version of iC.

    The MAKE command for this device looks like:
    MAKE dT; Yokogawa DL9000; TMCTL: USBTMC(DL9000) = SerialNumber (e.g. 27E000001)

    All device commands that the Yokogawa DL9000/DL92240L understands are implemented here.

    Instrument Commands:

    • getParameter(int, int, String)
    • SaveWaveform(String, String, boolean)
    • setAcquisitionMode(int)
    • setTimeBase(double)
    • Start()
    • Note that more commands are defined as generic commands
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Method Detail

      • Open

        public void Open()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.script.ScriptException
        A method for additional initializations after establishing the connection to the Instrument. This method is called from Dispatcher.HandleMakeCommand after calling Openinstrument. Does NOT call the superclass' Open method (because this class does not support GPIB communication, hence, calling the superclass is not required).

        Note that this method is not called when in Syntax-Check mode or when in No-Communication mode!

        Overrides:
        Open in class Device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an sending / receiving data caused an error
        javax.script.ScriptException

      • SaveWaveform

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Saves the specified Waveforms in a Text File.",
                   ParameterNames={"Channels to save","File Extension","Plot Waveforms?"},
                   ToolTips={"Comma separated list of Channels (1...4) to save.","",""},
                   DefaultValues={"1,2",".wv.txt","true"})
public float[][] SaveWaveform(java.lang.String ChannelsToSave,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean PlotWaveforms)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    javax.script.ScriptException
        Receives waveform data from the oscilloscope and saves it in a text file. The data can optionally be plotted in a chart; note that this plot contains only a limited number of data points to speed up plotting. When averaging is enabled on the scope, the averaged waveform is acquired, otherwise the most recent one is saved.
        Parameters:
        ChannelsToSave - Comma separated list of channels to save; can be 1..4 for "regular" channels 1 to 4. Could also be MATH1..4, or REFerence1..4 (same format as in :Waveform:Trace) but it's not clear that those traces have the same number of points, hence, saving and plotting might fail, and obtaining the channel setup will also fail.
        FileExtension - The File Extension appended to the FileName defined in the GUI to save the data
        PlotWaveforms - If true, the waveforms are also plotted in a chart, which is then also saved as a png file.
        Returns:
        Returns a float[][] with the Time in the first column and the voltages of the waveforms in the second, third, etc. columns. If an error occurred or in No-Communication Mode, the return value can be null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from SendViaTMCTL or QueryViaTMCTL.
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the DL9000's answer could not be converted to a number or the scope was not triggered.

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Start Data Acquisition.",

public void Start()

      • setAcquisitionMode

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sets the acquisition mode to Normal of Average.",
                   ParameterNames="Average Count",
                   ToolTips="<html>1 ... sets the ACQ Mode to Normal<br>2^n ... selects Average with Average Count (2...65535)</html>",
                   DefaultValues="16")
public void setAcquisitionMode(int AverageCount)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Sets the Acquisition Mode to either Normal or Average; it also sets the Average Count
        Parameters:
        AverageCount - If 1, Acquisition Mode Normal is selected, otherwise Average is selected and the selected Average Count is set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from SendToInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - When the Syntax-check fails

      • getParameter

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Queries the specified parameter calculated by the scope.",
                   ParameterNames={"Trace","Area","ParameterName"},
                   ToolTips={"Which waveform should be used to calculate the parameter? Can be 1-4","Over which area (time span) should the parameter be calculated? Can be 1 or 2","<html>The name of the parameter to calculate. Can be:<br>BURSt|CMEan|COUNt|CRMS|CSDeviation|DELay|DT|DUTYcycle|FALL|FREQuency|HIGH|<br>HILow|LOW|MAXimum|MEAN|MINimum|NOVershoot|NWIDth|PERFrequency|PERiod|POVershoot|<br>PTOPeak|PWIDth|RISE|RMS|SDEViation|TYCInteg|TYINteg|V1|V2.</html>"},
                   DefaultValues={"1","2","PTOP"})
public float getParameter(int Trace,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        int Area,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String ParameterName)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        javax.script.ScriptException
        The DL9000 can calculate certain parameters. This method allows to query these parameters from the scope. The 'Param' function must be enabled on the scope or else the parameters are not available.
        Parameters:
        Trace - Specifies which waveform should be used to calculate the parameter
        Area - The scope allows to specify two different areas (aka time spans) over which the parameters are calculated. Areas 1 spans per default the entire 10 time divisions
        ParameterName - The name of the parameter to calculate. Can be BURSt|CMEan|COUNt|CRMS|CSDeviation|DELay|DT|DUTYcycle|FALL|FREQuency|HIGH| HILow|LOW|MAXimum|MEAN|MINimum|NOVershoot|NWIDth|PERFrequency|PERiod|POVershoot| PTOPeak|PWIDth|RISE|RMS|SDEViation|TYCInteg|TYINteg|V1|V2.
        Returns:
        The numerical value of the parameter calculated by the scope
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from QueryInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - Bubbles up from getFloat

      • setTimeBase

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Set the Time Base (seconds / division).",
                   ParameterNames="Time Base",
                   ToolTips="Sets the Time Base to the smalles one available that is larger than the specified",
                   DefaultValues="1e-3")
public double setTimeBase(double TimeBase)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Finds the next largest time base (time per division) and sets it on the scope. Example: When this method is called with 1.2e-3 the time base is set to 2e-3 so that the desired waveform is shown in it's entirety.
        Parameters:
        TimeBase - The time base (time per division) to be set on the scope
        Returns:
        The next larger time base setting available on the scope
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from SendToInstrument
